org.apache.juneau.internal

Class ArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.internal.ArrayUtils

  • public final class ArrayUtils
extends Object
    Quick and dirty utilities for working with arrays.

        Appends one or more elements to an array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The element type.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to append to.
        newElements - The new elements to append to the array.
        Returns:
        A new array with the specified elements appended.

      • combine

        public static <T> T[] combine(T[]... arrays)
        Combine an arbitrary number of arrays into a single array.
        Parameters:
        arrays - Collection of arrays to combine.
        Returns:
        A new combined array, or null if all arrays are null.

      • reverse

        public static <T> T[] reverse(T[] array)
        Creates a new array with reversed entries.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to reverse.
        Returns:
        A new array with reversed entries, or null if the array was null.

      • reverseInline

        public static <T> T[] reverseInline(T[] array)
        Sorts the elements in an array without creating a new array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to sort.
        Returns:
        The same array.

      • asSet

        public static <T> Set<T> asSet(T[] array)
        Converts the specified array to a Set.

        The order of the entries in the set are the same as the array.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The entry type of the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array being wrapped in a Set interface.
        Returns:
        The new set.

      • iterator

        public static Iterator<Object> iterator(Object array)
        Returns an iterator against an array.

        This works with any array type (e.g. String[], Object[], int[], etc...).

        Parameters:
        array - The array to create an iterator over.
        Returns:
        An iterator over the specified array.

      • toArray

        public static <T> Object toArray(Collection<?> c,
                                 Class<T> componentType)
        Converts the specified collection to an array.

        Works on both object and primitive arrays.

        Parameters:
        c - The collection to convert to an array.
        componentType - The component type of the collection.
        Returns:
        A new array.

      • isArray

        public static boolean isArray(Object array)
        Returns true if the specified object is an array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to test.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is an array.

      • toList

        public static <T> List<T> toList(Object array,
                                 Class<T> componentType)
        Converts the specified array to an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        array - The array to convert.
        componentType - The type of objects in the array. It must match the actual component type in the array.
        Returns:
        A new ArrayList

      • toObjectArray

        public static <T> T[] toObjectArray(Collection<?> c,
                                    Class<T> componentType)
        Shortcut for calling myList.toArray(new T[myList.size()]);
        Parameters:
        c - The collection being converted to an array.
        componentType - The component type of the array.
        Returns:
        The collection converted to an array.

      • copyToList

        public static List copyToList(Object array,
                              List list)
        Copies the specified array into the specified list.

        Works on both object and primitive arrays.

        Parameters:
        array - The array to copy into a list.
        list - The list to copy the values into.
        Returns:
        The same list passed in.

      • contains

        public static <T> boolean contains(T element,
                                   T[] array)
        Returns true if the specified array contains the specified element using the Object.equals(Object) method.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check for.
        array - The array to check.
        Returns:
        true if the specified array contains the specified element, false if the array or element is null.

      • indexOf

        public static <T> int indexOf(T element,
                              T[] array)
        Returns the index position of the element in the specified array using the Object.equals(Object) method.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check for.
        array - The array to check.
        Returns:
        The index position of the element in the specified array, or -1 if the array doesn't contain the element, or the array or element is null.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(String element,
                               String[] array)
        Returns true if the specified array contains the specified element using the String.equals(Object) method.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check for.
        array - The array to check.
        Returns:
        true if the specified array contains the specified element, false if the array or element is null.

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(String element,
                          String[] array)
        Returns the index position of the element in the specified array using the String.equals(Object) method.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check for.
        array - The array to check.
        Returns:
        The index position of the element in the specified array, or -1 if the array doesn't contain the element, or the array or element is null.

      • toPrimitiveArray

        public static Object toPrimitiveArray(Object o)
        Converts a primitive wrapper array (e.g. Integer[]) to a primitive array (e.g. int[]).
        Parameters:
        o - The array to convert. Must be a primitive wrapper array.
        Returns:
        A new array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If object is not a wrapper object array.

        public static List<?> toList(Iterable<?> i)
        Converts an Iterable to a list.
        Parameters:
        i - The iterable to convert.
        Returns:
        A new list of objects copied from the iterable.

      • getFirst

        public static Object getFirst(Object val)
        Returns the first object in the specified collection or array.
        Parameters:
        val - The collection or array object.
        Returns:
        The first object, or null if the collection or array is empty or null or the value isn't a collection or array.

      • toStringArray

        public static String[] toStringArray(Collection<?> c)
        Converts the specified collection to an array of strings.

        Entries are converted to strings using Object.toString(). null values remain null.

        Parameters:
        c - The collection to convert.
        Returns:
        The collection as a string array.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(String[] a1,
                             String[] a2)
        Returns true if the following sorted arrays are equals.
        Parameters:
        a1 - Array #1.
        a2 - Array #2.
        Returns:
        true if the following sorted arrays are equals.

      • toReverseArray

        public static <T> T[] toReverseArray(Class<T> c,
                                     Collection<T> l)
        Converts a collection to an array containing the elements in reversed order.
        Parameters:
        c - The component type of the array.
        l - The collection to convert.
        The collection is not modified.
        Returns:
        A new array, or null if the collection was null.

      • remove

        public static Object[] remove(Object element,
                              Object[] array)
        Removes the specified element from the specified array.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to remove from the array.
        array - The array to remove the element from.
        Returns:
        A new array with the element removed, or the original array if the array did not contain the element.
